full_summary:
# Request for Proposal for G-Suits Contract

## Contract Overview

The Department of National Defence (DND) invites proposals for the procurement of G-suits for use by the Canadian Armed Forces. The contract is to be awarded through a competitive open bidding process.

### Contract Overview and Endorsements

The DND has identified a requirement for the procurement of 320 G-suits, to be delivered to Canadian Forces when possible. The contract will be awarded to the bidder who submits the lowest priced proposal that meets the requirements outlined in the bid solicitation document.

### Items and Quantities

The following items are to be procured:

* Anti-G Garments, cutaway, as per MIL-DTL-83406D specification, with the following quantities:
	+ Lot 1: 80 units
	+ Lot 2: 60 units
	+ Lot 3: 90 units
	+ Lot 4: 60 units
	+ Lot 5: 50 units
	+ Lot 6: 40 units
	+ Lot 7: 90 units

### Instructions to Tenderers

Tenderers may submit their proposals electronically using the epost Connect service or by submitting their proposals in person at the specified bid receiving unit. All proposals must comply with the requirements outlined in the bid solicitation document.

### Additional Information

A notice for proposed procurement was issued on April 5, 2023, for the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, and Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement.

### Document Availability and Requirements

Documents in either official language of Canada may be obtained from the Government of Canada's electronic tendering service, Canada Buys. Prospective bidders must also register with the Government of Canada's electronic procurement service, Canada Buys, to access the solicitation documents.

### Evaluation Criteria

The proposal will be evaluated based on the price, as identified in the bid solicitation document. Bidders who propose an equivalent or substitute product must provide the brand name and model and/or part number and NCAGE number for the proposed product.

### Important Dates

The closing date for submissions is May 23, 2023, at 2:00 p.m. EST. The expected contract start date is May 9, 2023, and the expected contract end date is August 31, 2023.

## Contact Information
